polymer-flex-layout.name: polymer-flex-layout
polymer-flex-layout.description:
polymer-flex-layout provides a helper to use CSS3 Flexible Boxes. By putting polymer-flex-layout inside an element it makes the element a flex container. Use 'flex' attribute to make the flex item flexible. Example:
Left
Main
Right
--------------------------------- |-------------------------------| ||Left| Main |Right|| |-------------------------------| ---------------------------------
Header
Body
Footer
---------- ||------|| ||Header|| ||------|| ||Body || || || || || || || || || || || || || ||------|| ||Footer|| ||------|| ----------

classitems.description: If true, flex items are aligned vertically.
classitems.name: vertical

classitems.description:
Defines the default for how flex items are laid out along the cross axis on 
the current line.  Possible values are 'start', 'center' and 'end'.
classitems.name: align

classitems.description:
Defines how flex items are laid out along the main axis on the current line.
Possible values are 'start', 'center' and 'end'.
classitems.name: justify

classitems.description:
If true, polymer-flex-layout is the flex container. Example:
Left
Main
Right
 --------------------------------- |-------------------------------| ||Left| Main |Right|| |-------------------------------| ---------------------------------
classitems.name: isContainer
